frameDefinitions: A Communicator (whose Location may be indicated) directs a Communication to an Addressee at a particular Address.
A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
In this frame an Informer informs the Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper Behavior of the Wrongdoer. '
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
frameExamples: Disgruntled voters <t>phoned</t> Congressman Neil at his Washington residence with complaints about the recent increases in corporate welfare.
I <t>sent</t> the manuscript to England to Bill.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
Tony <t>reported</t> Michael to the police for breaking into his car.
The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a message to another person.
The person that receives the message from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
This role is used for a (metaphorical) place in a system of communication where <fen>Communicator</fen>s and <fen>Addressee</fen>s can access the system.

The information that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wishes to impart to the <fen>Addressee</fen>, often to get a particular response. In this frame the <fen>Communication</fen> is not necessarily received by the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
This is the subject matter to which the message pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name='Goal'>to the shed</fex>.

The objects being sent.
I mailed <fex name='Theme'>the books</fex> <fex name='Goal'>to Alaska</fex>.
Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated.
They <t>mailed</t><fex name='Theme'>a questionnaire</fex> <fex name='Theme'>with a return envelope</fex>.

The mode of sending employed.
I <t>shipped</t> <fex name='Theme'>the crops</fex> <fex name='Transport_means'>by bigrig </fex>.

This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fex name='Sender'>Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name='Theme'>a letter</fex> <fex name='Recipient'> to Abby</fex>
When the sending takes place
A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Informer</fen> reports the activities of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> to the <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> has his or her activities reported to the <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> are the officials, government or otherwise, who handle misbehavior.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action or actions for which the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is reported.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Informer</fen> reports the <fen>Behavior</fen> of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the reporting occurs.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
listRoleExamples: The company must be able to call <fex> potential customers</fex>.
I sent the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>.
Barney posted the letter on Monday <fex>in Athens</fex>
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
<fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
